metadata.title: CVE-2023-0430 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Certificate OCSP revocation status was not checked when verifying S/Mimesignatures. Mail signed with a revoked certificate would be displayed ashaving a valid signature. Thunderbird versions from 68 to 102.7.0 wereaffected by this bug. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 102.7.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
